name: Econo Lodge Hicksville

reviews.text: We went on a long 8 day trip across Canada and NY, stayed in hotels of varying star levels in this trip. Before I left I reserved the Econolodge, Hicksville since it was a good deal although I had lot of inhibitions about how bad the experience is going to be based on some of the reviews I read that suggested what a dump it was.
reviews.title: Good experience - Nothing like the bad reviews

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised since the hotel was clean, front desk folks were courteous and helpful. The hotel is little old but the rooms very spacious & clean. Bathrooms were clean too. The simple breakfast was just enough, bagels muffins, milk and cereal that kept me going till lunch time. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Basic cheap lodging

reviews.text: If you always stay in a Hyatt or a Westin then this may not be suitable for you so feel free to spend $250 or higher per night but if you are travelling to NY like me to spend a weekend in the city with the family and a clean & reasonably priced place to get back and rest then I definitely recommend it. BTW this is also in a safe area of Long Island.
reviews.title: Not bad at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed here because it was the Choice Hotel closest to the family we were visiting. There was practically no counter space in the bathroom--thank goodness I had a toiletry bag to hang on the door. Everything about the bathroom, shower stall, ceiling, floor, was low quality. And like the Quality Inn in VT we stayed in, there was no ventilation fan so everything was wet after a hot shower. The breakfast offered was very basic--regular Cheerios or Raisin Bran, one kind of muffin, one kind of bagel, OJ and coffee. At least the beds were comfortable. If you're just passing through and need an inexpensive bed for the night, this hotel would suffice. There's a reason it's called Econo Lodge--you get what you pay for, and next time I think I'll pay a little more and stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: A good night's sleep and a helpful staff.

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week at the end of April as I'm between houses at the moment. The Econo Lodge in Hicksville is actually a good deasl for the money.
reviews.title: Diamond in the Rough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Econolodge so as not to be a burden on friends and family we visit. The rooms were dirty in all the corners. I had switched rooms to get away from the noisy cars on the highway.
reviews.title: dirty, depressing- I recommend one 15 minutes away

reviews.text: The same candy wrapper was out in the hallway for the 3 nights we stayed. I didn't pick it up, just to see if the "maids" would step over it every day rather than clean the hall.
reviews.title: Decent Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathrooms was half cleaned, and the construction was lousy - caulk and drywall by an amateur repairman. Breakfast was fairly lame, but I didn't expect much.
reviews.title: It's Econo Lodge, it works.

reviews.text: Go to Gateway Hotel , Sunrise Highway, Merrick, NY 11566
reviews.title: Be very afraid!

reviews.text: Basic, clean hotel with good breakfast near LIRR. We paid about the same price for a much better room, in a much more presentable motel. It's a short drive from Hicksville.
reviews.title: bad a bad motel

reviews.text: Econolodge in Hicksville, Long island. Free breakfast was bagels, muffins, juice and coffee. There’s a cigarette smell all around the downstairs area and in hallway. Maybe downstairs room allowed smoking? Large bed. Toilet paper was very scratchy. Not a great reception or reception area but it’s somewhat cheap. Should have stayed at La Quinta near Islap/Bohemia airport like my brother and mom did!
reviews.title: Smoky (yuck!) but cheap

reviews.text: I can usually get something in the vicinity through Priceline, but I was unsuccessful in bidding, so I remembered this hotel from a previous stay and decided to book a room through Southwest's site for $89. I will get .5 flight credit. I refuse to pay $165 or more for basic sleeping accomodations at a nearby Fairfield or Hampton Inn that are just a notch above. This property is a bit dated, the hallway carpet is a bit off, but offers basic accomodations, free continental breakfast, and free wifi. The location is good right between the North and South Shores of Long Island. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My only complaint is the "window" air conditioner that is cut through the wall, its kind of noisy, but the coils were clean and it cooled the room quickly. However, I really didn't need it during my stay. There is a supermarket nearby and several restaurants as well. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Long Island for the cheap

likes.liked: — good value compared to other lodging choices in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Econo for one week in September - the room is well fitted out - a nice spacious room, microwave, fridge and standard bathroom.
reviews.title: I'd Live in Hinksville!

reviews.text: Breakfast was basic - bagels, tea/coffee or cereal. The amenities are also basic however given the hotel rate - value for money in the scheme of things.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: Hinksville is a very quiet area and is ideal for living in, rather than holidaying. The journey to the train station was around 2 miles away so we had to take a taxi each day but once we were at the train station all the major sites were on the Long Island train route. You do need to study the train map and ask questions - it is not easy to pick up. Do remember that the subway is a killer - very claustraphobic and extremely humid (until you actually board the train).
reviews.title: Clean and resonably priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Under $100 in the NY metropolitan area? We like it. Mattress a little firm, carpet could use a good cleaning and the counter space in the bathroom was non-existent but generally we enjoyed our stay in a clean comfortable room in a quiet area. Breakfast was bagels juice and coffee. We had low expectations and were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Very Good Value - Get what you pay for

reviews.text: I drove from South Carolina to New York on business. We arrived a few hours early. I was shocked when I was informed that I had to pay $25 to check in a few hours early. I'm a road warrior and business owner. I've never been charged extra to check in early. We quickly left and wasted time at the mall and Nathans.
reviews.title: Good value for the money, but don't arrive early.

reviews.text: Once we arrived in the room, we were surprised that the room was clean and nice for a two star hotel. Although the breakfast has a lot to be desired, I would stay there again. It is minutes from the mall, family court, and other key places in Nassau County. The value is good, and it's not too far from my office.
reviews.title: PERFECT PLACE ON A BUDGET

reviews.text: I went home to visit family so I didn't want to spend allot of money. The EconoLodge was perfect. The price was right, the room was very clean with a microwave and mini refrig. I needed a late checkout and Dennis at the front desk was very helpful. The staff was very friendly. Also they had breakfast included. I was pleasantly surprised with the budget motel. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Econolodge had quick service and was decently clean.
JC was very accomodating and professional during our stay
reviews.text: Econolodge had quick service and was decently clean. It was cheaper than most motels in the area.

description: If you are traveling to Long Island for business or pleasure, this Long Island Hotel includes a multitude of amenities to accommodate you and your travel needs. Our property maintains 82 newly remodeled guest rooms with microwave/refrigerator combinations in every room and Free Wireless High Speed Internet Access. We have spacious rooms with one king size bed or a room with two double beds, whichever you prefer. Each room has upgraded luxury bedding and flat screen televisions.We are are a Nassau County Hotel in the center of Nassau County, conveniently located near Garden City, Jericho, Westbury, Syosset and Plainview. Nearby you will find shopping, restaurants, businesses and catering facilities in this Long Island metro area.
